Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Mac OS X - Get Current WIFI Signal Strength
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Mac

Body.description:
Description: Detects current disk temperature and writes the results to a custom field and in the the script log.
Kaseya customer value: Procedure to secure clients from unwanted downtime and data loss.
End user value: Limiting the risks for unwanted downtime and data loss.
Dependencies: Windows OS. Make sure you have created "CF Disk Temp" (string) under "Audit, Custom Fields".
Usage: Run at any given time.
Report options: Procedure Log, content: "GetDiskTemp:*" and Aggregate Table, Diskt Temp.
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is". No support included.

Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Mac OS X - System - Get Kernel Version
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Mac

Statement.description: Create a custom field named "CF OS X Kernel" and update step 5 before running.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Windows - Get .NET 4.5 Version Number
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Windows

If.description: Procedure description: Get version of .net 4.5 Kaseya customer value: Procedure for pro-active support and troubleshooting. Knowing the age of the OS. End user value: Knowing the .net version Dependencies: Windows OS. CUT present i Kworking. Custom field "CF_dotNET_Version" Usage: Schedule once or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for "Upstream: .NET Version" before, during and after update deployment statements. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 1: We need GREP and CUT later on. Let's download if not present. Don't trust us? Look for GNU win32 on Sourceforge.

Statement.description: Get HEX reg value for .net 4.5
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: REG QUERY "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP\v4\Full" /v /e /f Release | find "Release" | #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\cut -c29-35 >> #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\dotnet.results

Statement.description: Convert from HEX to DEC
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

If.description: Convert DEC to version number and put custom field and procedure log

Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se Last change: 2017-09-28 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ First we need a file.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: OS Install Date: No result exists. Run "wmic os get installdate" manually to troubleshoot.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Disktemp: The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.

Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Windows - Get Current WIFI Signal Strength
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Windows

Statement.description: Procedure description: Get current WIFI SSID and signal strength. Kaseya customer value: Procedure for pro-active support and troubleshooting. End user value: Limiting the risks for unwanted external Java related attacks, downtime and data loss. Dependencies: Windows OS. GREP and CUT present i Kworking. Custom fields "CF Last Used Wifi SSID" and "CF Last Wifi Signal Strength". Usage: Schedule or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for "UPSTREAM: Wifi Info:" before, during and after update deployment statements. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 1: We need GREP and CUT later on. Let's download if not present. Don't trust us? Look for GNU win32 on Sourceforge.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Entering Stage 1. Copy GREP and CUT if needed.

Statement.description: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 2: We look for WLAN statistics and do a little old school text manipulation with GREP and CUT.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Entering Stage 2: The WIFI audit part.

Statement.description: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 3: Let's get the results back in to Kaseya by populating custom fields and the Agent Procedure Log.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Entering Stage 3: Getting the results back to Kaseya.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Wifi SSID #current_wifi_ssid# detected.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Error: SSID variable not detected. Try to run the command "netsh wlan show" manually to troubleshoot.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Wifi Strength #current_wifi_signal_strength# detected.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: Error: Signal Strength variable not detected. Try to run the command "netsh wlan show" manually to troubleshoot.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Wifi Info: The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.

Statement.name: UpdateSystemInfo

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Get OS Language: UK English.

Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Windows - Get SMART Status For C
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Windows

Body.description:
Description: Detects current disk health and writes the results to the script log.
Kaseya customer value: Procedure to secure clients from unwanted downtime and data loss.
End user value: Limiting the risks for unwanted downtime and data loss.
Dependencies: Windows OS.
Usage: Run at any given time.
Report options: Procedure Log, content: "SMART:*", Aggregate Table, SMART.
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is". No support included.

If.description: Important! Create a custom field named "CF SMART Health". You need to reload the Agent Procedure Editor after creating the custom field. First, let's test if the files needed are present on the machine. Don't trust our Dropbox? You can upload these files to your own Kaseya server in "Managed Files" and use the step writeFile to replace getURL.

Statement.description: Let's execute stmartctl.exe and put the results in a text file. In this example we are testing the C: drive.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Pause this procedure for 30 seconds to give a previous action time to complete.
Statement.name: PauseScript

Statement.description: Let's create a variable from the contet in smart.result
Statement.name: GetVariable

Statement.description: Let's start with a default "No Value" in the Custom Field as a default.
Statement.name: UpdateSystemInfo

If.description: Some disks report a positive SMART result like this: "SMART Health Status: OK". Let's check for the content : OK in the smart.result log.

Statement.description: We put "Healthy" in the Custom Audit filed based on the file content ": OK".
Statement.name: UpdateSystemInfo

If.description: Most disks report a positive SMART result like this: "SMART overall-health self-assessment test result: PASSED". Let's check for the content : PASSED in the smart.result log.

Statement.description: We put "Healthy" in the Custom Audit filed based on the file content ": PASSED".
Statement.name: UpdateSystemInfo

Statement.description: We put "Healthy" in the Custom Audit filed based on the file content ": UNKNOWN! ".
Statement.name: UpdateSystemInfo

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: SMART Status: Unknown. This means we didn't get any feedback from SMART Disk Controller. Is this a virtual machine?

Statement.description: We put "Warning!" in the Custom Audit filed based on the file content ": PASSED".
Statement.name: UpdateSystemInfo

Statement.description: Let's raise a alert in the Monitor Alert log.
Statement.name: SendAlert

Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Windows - Get SQL Version
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Windows

If.description: Procedure description: Get the SQL version from the registry. Kaseya customer value: Knowing the SQL version and the associated costs. End user value: Knowing the SQL version and the associated costs. Dependencies: Windows OS. MS SQL present. Custom field CF SQL Version. Usage: Schedule once or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for "UPSTREAM: Get SQL Version:". Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ We do a REG query to get the SQL version regsitry information in a text text file.
By looking at the version presented in the text file we set the proper version in the custom filed "CF SQL Vesion".

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Get SQL Version: The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.

Procedure.name: Custom Field - Audit - Windows - Scan for Intel Mgmnt Engine Vulnerability
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack.Extended Audit (Custom Fields Required) 2019-02-28.Windows

Statement.description: Procedure description: Evaluate if system has Intel vulnerability (Intel-SA-00086) More information: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/articles/000025619/software.html Kaseya customer value: Procedure to quickly check system vurnability. End user value: Limiting the risk of secuirty breach. Dependencies: Windows OS. Usage: Schedule, Recurring or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for before, during and after update deployment statements. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Downloading Intel vurnability detection tool.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Running detection tool. See next log entry for result.

Statement.description: IMPORTANT: You have to cd to the same directory of the tool first and then execute it. It will NOT work if you execute with a path (ex C:\path\to\file\Intel-SA-00086.exe). "findstr" is to get the vulnerability string, pipe it to a file to later get it as a variale.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Value
Parameter.value: Based on the analysis performed by this tool:

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: This system is not vulnerable

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: This outputfile does not exist or does not conatin any data.

Statement.description: House cleaning.
Statement.name: Delete Directory
